pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">You want to ask Dr. Bennett a question about the row of the Value Map called "Why." Which metric below should you have prepared to ask about to tie in with Sunnydale Psychiatry’s priorities?</welcomeText >

choice.choiceText: A. Refill rates
B. Patient satisfaction
C. New Patient Visits Per Month
D. Patient Call Backs Per Month

pageContent.summary: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Although Dr. Bennett has expressed to you that he is focused on achieving positive patient outcomes, it doesn’t necessarily follow that patient satisfaction or new patient visits per month (Choices B and C) would be the best metric to measure the practice’s progress toward that priority. Sunnydale Psychiatry might be concerned with measuring patient call backs per month (Choice D), as that could be an indication of successfully treated patients who experience minimal impact of side effects, but that metric is not as closely linked to the priorities you just confirmed with Dr. Bennett. Higher refill rates is the metric which ties in closest to Sunnydale Psychiatry’s priorities of achieving positive patient outcomes and addressing or controlling side effects. Choice A is the best answer.</welcomeText>
